{"name":"553dabd19954a9d39969","layouts":[{"id":0,"position":{"x":738.75,"y":128.99993896484375,"z":4000,"width":647.5,"height":237.5,"tabOrder":4000}}],"singleVisual":{"visualType":"textbox","drillFilterOtherVisuals":true,"objects":{"general":[{"properties":{"paragraphs":[{"textRuns":[{"value":"LULUCF sector means land use sector (land use, land use change and forestry). On the left we see what the total emissions have been according to StatFin 2023 data over the years with and without the land use sector. We see that the emissions have a decreasing trend overall since the early 2000, but that land use sector has created reverse effects after 2015. This data includes also other greenhouse gasses apart from carbon dioxide (CO2).","textStyle":{"fontSize":"14pt"}}]}]}}]},"vcObjects":{"title":[{"properties":{"show":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"true"}}},"text":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"'LULUCF versus no LULUCF years 1990-2023'"}}},"heading":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"'Heading2'"}}},"bold":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"true"}}},"fontSize":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"15D"}}}}}],"subTitle":[{"properties":{"show":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"false"}}}}}],"divider":[{"properties":{"show":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"true"}}}}}],"border":[{"properties":{"show":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"false"}}},"radius":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"18D"}}}}}]}}}

{"name":"2480e03ca3d5a1582ddd","layouts":[{"id":0,"position":{"x":26.25,"y":113.75,"z":1000,"width":576.25,"height":478.75,"tabOrder":1000}}],"singleVisual":{"visualType":"textbox","drillFilterOtherVisuals":true,"objects":{"general":[{"properties":{"paragraphs":[{"textRuns":[{"value":"Main emission categories in the dataset are agriculture, energy, industrial processes and land use. Energy comprises of energy industry,  transport, housing and aspects from another category, namely agricultural machine use. From the chart on the right we can see that it is clearly the dominant category of the emissions. ","textStyle":{"fontSize":"14pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"We see from the graph below, that the emissions from the energy category has a clear downward trend over the years. ","textStyle":{"fontSize":"14pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Industrial processes and agriculture are the second most important emission categories. Industrial processes include such emission sources as chemical industry as well as refigeration and air conditioning. There is virtually no change in these categories over the years. ","textStyle":{"fontSize":"14pt"}}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":""}]},{"textRuns":[{"value":"Land use includes sub categories such as forest, cropland, grassland, wetland and settlement. Here we see the trend starting from about 2015, in which the net in-take of gasses decreases or turns to emissions. ","textStyle":{"fontSize":"14pt"}}]}]}}]},"vcObjects":{"title":[{"properties":{"show":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"true"}}},"text":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"'Main emission categories'"}}},"fontSize":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"15D"}}},"heading":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"'Heading2'"}}},"bold":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"true"}}}}}],"divider":[{"properties":{"show":{"expr":{"Literal":{"Value":"true"}}}}}]}}}
